text:
In fresh escalation of political violence in poll-bound Kerala, a 28-year-old Youth Congress worker was hacked to death, allegedly by workers of the Democratic Youth Federation of India (DYFI) at Evoor in Alappuzha district early on Tuesday even as BJP and CPI(M) workers clashed in Thiruvananthapuram district, leaving at least 30 injured.

Police sources said Youth Congress worker Sunil Kumar was woken up from sleep at 2 a.m. on Tuesday by eight activists of the DYFI, the youth wing of the CPI(M), and attacked as he ran out of the house.

Mr. Kumar suffered serious injuries on his hands and legs and later succumbed to his wounds, police said. The victim was said to have been a DYFI activist earlier.

Four DYFI workers have been arrested, police said, adding that a hunt was on for others.

On Monday night, BJP and CPI(M) workers clashed at Kattayikonam in Thiruvananthapuram, leaving at least 30 injured.

One of them is reportedly in a serious condition.

Former BJP State president V Muraleedharan was among those injured in stone-throwing, allegedly by CPI(M) workers.

Demanding the arrest of the accused, the BJP observed a hartal in the district on Tuesday.

The CPI(M) too called for a hartal on Tuesday in Kattayikonam. — PTI
title: Youth Cong. worker murdered
